title: Robert Prevost elected as Pope Leo XIV
summary: Appointed by Francis as prefect of the strategic Dicastery for Bishops, this native of Chicago has supported the Argentine pope's reforms. He is the first American pope.

title: Trump, Starmer announce US-UK trade agreement
summary: US President Donald Trump held a joint press conference with UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Thursday to make the announcement.

title: 92 dead in 24 hours: An ordinary day of horror in the Gaza Strip
summary: Israeli bombings on Wednesday devastated a market as well as two schools serving as shelters for displaced people. Since Israel broke the ceasefire in mid-March, dozens of Palestinians have perished under its airstrikes every day.

title: Military operation in Pakistan reveals weaknesses of India's air force
summary: New Delhi has begun to acknowledge the loss of several fighter jets during 'Operation Sindoor.' Military experts suggest that at least one Rafale may be among the destroyed aircraft. This would mark the first loss in combat for the French aircraft.

title: Banking secrecy: Switzerland clamps down on journalists but uses their revelations
summary: The law in force within the country prohibits exploiting banking data leaks without any exception for public interest. Yet Swiss authorities have relied on the press to scrutinize banks' malpractices, as revealed by our new investigation into Reyl.

title: Los Angeles Coliseum and SoFi Stadium to share opening and closing ceremonies for 2028 Olympics
summary: It will be the Coliseum’s third time hosting the ceremony – the most in Olympic history – and it’ll be the first time two locations have shared it. SoFi will also host swimming at the Games.

title: Leo XIV, a global citizen, engages in US public debate
summary: The election of Robert Francis Prevost, not particularly favored by the MAGA world, received minimal acknowledgment from the president of the United States. While the 267th pope took care not to appear as a representative of the American Catholic Church, he might criticize the Trump administration for its hostility towards refugees.

title: Merz says Trump will 'strongly support' European efforts to end Ukraine war
summary: Merz spoke with Trump by phone for the first time, which went 'very well,' according to Stefan Kornelius, a government spokesperson. The new German Chancellor also spoke with Zelensky on Thursday and reaffirmed Germany's solidarity with and support for Ukraine, the rep added.

title: 'Inheritance is an injustice': Why a 33-year-old redistributed €27 million
summary: After the death of her grandmother, Marlene Engelhorn, the descendant of the founder of the German chemical and pharmaceutical companies BASF inherited nearly €27 million. An advocate for taxing the wealthy, she donated 92% of that sum to charities.

title: Israeli intelligence to help Ecuador in war on cartels, says Noboa
summary: Ecuadoran President Daniel Noboa, who won re-election last month, said that Israel and the UAE have agreed to provide intelligence to help fight the cocaine traffickers who are terrorizing the country.

title: Flag bearers: Young custodians of France's history
summary: Photojournalist Guillaume Herbaut went to meet a new generation of flag bearers stepping in for veterans during commemoration ceremonies. His gentle and luminous portraits depict adolescents from diverse backgrounds, united by a shared sense of citizenship.

title: European media praises PSG: 'They have won so many admirers across the continent'
summary: The Paris team's performance in defeating Arsenal in the Champions League semi-finals on Wednesday was lauded the press, highlighting a change in the club's direction pushed by coach Luis Enrique.

title: India and Pakistan accuse each other of using drone waves in a deadly escalation
summary: At least 48 deaths have been reported from both sides of the border after the worst violence between the two countries in decades.

title: Hitler's last 10 days
summary: Secluded in his Berlin bunker since late March 1945, the Führer continued the war until April 22, when, for the first time, he conceded defeat. Adolf Hitler committed suicide eight days later, on April 30.

title: Family of feminicide victim sues French state for 'gross negligence'
summary: Nathalie Debaillie, 47, reported her former partner Jérôme Tonneau to the police four times. Believing that the police's inaction proved fatal to her, her brother, her two children, and the children's father have sued the state for their inaction.

title: Macron and Merz's 'friendship' doesn't erase fundamental differences
summary: The new German chancellor was welcomed at the Elysée Palace by Emmanuel Macron on Wednesday for his first foreign trip.

title: Benedict, Francis, Paul and others: How do popes choose their names?
summary: While speculation mounts over the identity of the next pope, equally intriguing is the name he will choose, as it may offer an early indication of the direction he wishes to steer his pontificate.

title: French diplomat Pierre Vimont: 'Putin wants to take down the world order as it has existed since 1945'
summary: Europe is likely to experience prolonged instability, even if a ceasefire is reached in Ukraine, explains the diplomat in an interview with Le Monde, on the occasion of the 80th anniversary of the end of World War II.

title: A century of resistance: Booksellers at Madrid's Cuesta de Moyano
summary: The booksellers of Madrid's 'casetas' celebrate their centenary with a tandem event with Parisian 'bouquinistes.' These two institutions are the last permanent open-air book fairs in European capitals.

title: Trump admin asks Supreme Court for permission to revoke the status of over 530,000 migrants
summary: District Judge Indira Talwani, an appointee of former president Barack Obama, blocked the administration last month from revoking the legal status of the migrants.

title: In Russia's Veliky Novgorod, May 9 commemorations are 'a celebration with tears'
summary: Like everywhere else in Russia, this city, located between Moscow and Saint Petersburg, is preparing a commemoration of the war against Nazi Germany. The authorities aim to use it to justify the offensive in Ukraine.

title: Sergey Parkhomenko, Russian journalist: 'Vladimir Putin privatized the 1945 victory for his own benefit'
summary: The Russian journalist, in an interview with Le Monde, analyzes the militaristic propaganda created by the Kremlin around the end of World War II, celebrated in Russia on May 9, which led to the invasion of Ukraine in 2022.

title: The US signs first customs agreement with the UK
summary: Presented on Thursday, May 8, the trade agreement signed between London and Washington allows the UK to ease American tariffs, particularly on cars, in exchange for a broader opening to American agricultural products.

title: Up to 1,000 transgender troops are being moved out of the military in new Pentagon order
summary: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, who issued the latest memo, made his views clear after the court’s decision: 'No More Trans @ DoD,' he wrote in a post on X.

title: Leo XIV, first US pope, to celebrate first mass as pontiff
summary: The 69-year-old new pope will return to the Sistine Chapel on Friday to celebrate a private mass with cardinals that will be broadcast by the Vatican, delivering his much anticipated first homily as pope.

title: Five Marseille restaurants offering dishes as diverse as the southern port city
summary: Indulge in the delights of a Tunisian pastry shop, Turkish charcoal-grilled specialties or Neapolitan pizzas with Olympique de Marseille (OM) fans. Le Monde has selected five addresses with Mediterranean flavors.

title: The letters from two Ukrainian sisters: 'In my mind and body, I have reached breaking point. I can't take it anymore'
summary: Sasha and Olga Kurovska are two Ukrainian sisters, one lives in Kyiv, the other in Paris. This month, they share their horror at the massive bombing launched on Kyiv on April 24 and their skepticism toward the peace negotiations led by Trump.

title: Melting sea ice alters color of Arctic and Antarctic oceans
summary: Without an ice layer on the ocean's surface, the light penetrating the waters changes, affecting the type of algae and plankton developing there. A study published in 'Nature' warns of a chain reaction of consequences.

title: Leo XIV, a pope of balance and appeasement
summary: The American Robert Francis Prevost's affiliation with the mendicant order of the Augustinians, known for their commitment to tradition and charity, and his understanding of the Curia contribute to a reassuring image. Grounded in modernity and mindful of the marginalized, his pontificate promises 'unity' and collegiality.

title: India-Pakistan: The two countries have spiraled into a conflict that brings them ever closer to war
summary: The Indian army launched a drone attack on military sites in Punjab, prompting a Pakistani response in Indian Kashmir. Both nuclear powers blame each other for the deteriorating situation.

title: France, Poland to seal alliance with strategic treaty
summary: Emmanuel Macron and Donald Tusk will meet in the eastern French city of Nancy on Friday afternoon to sign an accord on 'mutual security guarantees.'

title: Russia marks 80 years the end of WWII as Ukraine war continues
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin hosted China's Xi Jinping and 20 other foreign dignitaries in a lavish Victory Day parade on Moscow's Red Square on Friday.

title: EU's cautious steps toward a response to Trump tariffs
summary: The European Commission has threatened to impose additional taxes on a wide range of American products, such as cars and airplanes. But its priority is to move without breaking its unity.
